Package it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.player

Class PlayerTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.player.PlayerTest
  • class PlayerTest
extends java.lang.Object

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private Match match  
      private Player player  

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      PlayerTest()  

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      (package private) void addDamageTokens()
      This test covers the methods addDamageTokens and addDamageToken (which calls addDamageTokens) in the following situations: - adding tokens in "standard" configurations - adding tokens when the player has marks given by the attacker - adding tokens when the player has marks, but not belonging to the attacker - adding enough tokens to kill the player - adding an overkill token and some extra tokens that are not counted
      (package private) void addMarks()
      This test covers the methods addMarks and addMark (which calls addMarks) in the following situations: - adding up to three marks of the same player - trying to add a fourth mark of the same player, which results in nothing - adding another mark, but belonging to a different player
      (package private) void bringBackToLife()
      This test covers the method bringBackToLife in the following situations: - dead player that shall be brought back to life
      (package private) void chooseWeapon()
      This test covers the method chooseWeapon in the following situations: - choosing a valid weapon - trying to choose an unloaded weapon - trying to choose a weapon that does not belong to the player
      (package private) void getAvailableMacroActions()
      This test covers the method getAvailableMacroActions in the following situations: - player has less than 3 damage (2) in standard mode - player has more than 3 damage (3, 5) but less than 6 in standard mode - player has more than 6 damage (6) in standard mode - player's turn is before the first player turn in final frenzy - player's turn is after the first player turn in final frenzy - player is the first player in final frenzy
      (package private) void grabAmmoCubes()
      This test covers the method grabAmmoCubes in the following situations: - grabbing up to the max number of ammoCubes allowed of each color - trying to grab more ammoCubes when player already has the maximum allowed of that color
      (package private) void grabPowerup()
      This test covers the method grabPowerup in the following situations: - grabbing up to 3 powerups - trying to buy a fourth powerup, which is not allowed
      (package private) void grabWeapon()
      This test covers the method grabWeapon in the following situations: - grabbing a weapon with enough money - trying to grab a weapon the player can't afford - trying to discard a weapon when the player can still buy more weapons - grabbing a weapon while already owning the max, but selecting a weapon to discard - trying to grab a weapon while already owning the max without discarding a weapon - trying to grab a weapon while already owning the max and discarding a not-owned weapon
      (package private) void onMatchModeChanged()
      This test covers the method onMatchModeChanged in the following situations: - standard: final frenzy for player with 0 damage (should flip the board) - standard: final frenzy for player with damage (should not flip the board)
      (package private) void pay()
      This test covers the method pay in the following situations: - paying with both ammoCubes and powerups - trying to pay with an empty wallet
      (package private) void reload()
      This test covers the method reload in the following situations: - reloading a weapon and paying in ammoCubes - trying to reload a weapon with money that is not owned
      (package private) void setUp()  
      (package private) void tearDown()  

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
